label: Product Comparison
text: Compare the features, pricing, and user experience of Product A and Product B.

label: Code Review
text: Review this code snippet for bugs and suggest improvements: [paste code here]

label: Meeting Summary
text: Summarize the key points and action items from our meeting about [topic].

label: Learning Plan
text: Create a 30-day learning plan for mastering [skill/technology].

label: Problem Solving
text: Help me troubleshoot this issue: [describe problem]

label: Business Email
text: Dear [Name], I'm writing to follow up on our recent discussion about the project timeline.

label: Technical Documentation
text: The system architecture consists of three main components: the frontend interface, the API layer, and the database.

label: Travel Phrases
text: Could you please direct me to the nearest train station? I need to purchase a ticket.

label: Product Description
text: Our flagship product features an intuitive interface, powerful analytics, and seamless integration with your existing tools.

label: Academic Abstract
text: This research examines the impact of artificial intelligence on workplace productivity across various industries.

label: Blog Introduction
text: Write an introduction for a blog post about sustainable living practices.

label: Product Description
text: Create a compelling product description for a new wireless headphone set.

label: Interview Questions
text: Generate interview questions for a senior software developer position.

label: Marketing Email
text: Draft a marketing email announcing our upcoming summer sale.

label: Feature Request
text: Write a detailed feature request for adding dark mode to our application.

label: Expert Summary
text: You are an expert summarizer. Read the following text carefully and produce a concise summary that captures the main ideas and key insights, removes redundancy, and uses clear, simple language. The summary should be 3-5 sentences maximum (shorter if possible) while preserving the original meaning and factual accuracy.

label: Bullet Points
text: Extract the most important points from the text and present them as a bulleted list. Focus on key facts, arguments, and conclusions. Aim for 5-7 bullet points that capture the essence of the content.

label: ELI5 (Explain Like I'm 5)
text: Simplify the following text as if explaining it to a child. Use simple vocabulary, short sentences, and relatable analogies. Avoid jargon and technical terms. The summary should be easy to understand for someone with no background knowledge on the topic.

label: Executive Brief
text: Create a professional executive summary suitable for busy decision-makers. Focus on business impact, strategic implications, and actionable insights. Be direct, factual, and highlight any metrics or KPIs mentioned in the text. Limit to 1-2 paragraphs.
